channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023121076
item.description:
Report X-2023121076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained three glass bottles in plastic bags with paper for dunnage. Two of the glass bottles were broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023121071
item.description:
Report X-2023121071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE SHIPMENT WAS REFUSED WHEN DRIVER AND CONSIGNEE NOTICED THAT IS WAS A DAMP. DRIVER BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE HUB. A RESPONDER WENT AND GOT IT FROM THE PACKAGE CAR AND OPENED IT. ONE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED. FOLLOWED DMP PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023120969
item.description:
Report X-2023120969

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box containing 5 gallon plastic bag / bladder found on HMPA staging pallet in lined tote. Prior events unknown. DescribePack: Loss of at least 0.2 gallon from slow leak due to crack in bottom of bag & defective seal between cap insert & bag/bladder. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023121077
item.description:
Report X-2023121077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office as an odor. While investigating the shipment it was discovered that one of the three bottles inside had broken spilling it's contents. The three bottles where packages in plastic bags with absorbent material wrapped around the bottle. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120968
item.description:
Report X-2023120968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box containing hazmat found on HMPA staging pallet. Mishandling: overhead scan at NASH 12/17 19:52. DescribePack: Loss of 0.2 gallon from internal corrosion of safety seal, compromised cap, and mishandling mentioned above. The paper found within the packaging adequately filled the outer packaging's 4 x 1 Gallon max capacity. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023120977
item.description:
Report X-2023120977

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACAKGE WAS DISCOVERED WET UPON VANLINE UNLOAD. PACKAGE REMOVED FROM VANLINE AND PLACED IN DAMAGE AREA ON TABLE. DescribePack: INNER PACKING WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP. CAP HAD A RING SEAL ON IT BUT WAS STILL LOOSE AND LEAKING. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM VAN, SET IN PROPER ORIENTATION AND PLACED IN DAMAGE AREA
